#Text=Wash LuLaRoe Leggings
#Text=LuLaRoe leggings are cute and are a great way to express your unique style .
#Text=Wearing them is exciting , but making the choice to wash them may cause nervousness .
#Text=While washing your leggings may seem difficult , there are tricks to keeping them clean while maintaining their appearance .
#Text=Learning to wash your leggings safely will help you get more use out of them and keep them in your closet longer .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Washing Your Leggings in the Washing Machine
#Text=Separate your leggings from the rest of your clothing .
#Text=If possible , separate all your leggings into a different laundry basket to ensure that none of your leggings get washed with your regular clothes .
#Text=Turn your leggings inside out .
#Text=This will help to preserve them .
#Text=Watch for stains so that you can to pay more attention to the stain-affected areas .
#Text=Purchase a gentle detergent .
#Text=Non-concentrated detergent is also safe to use .
#Text=Good detergent options include Tide , Gain , and Arm & Hammer .
#Text=If you use a generic detergent , make sure to check the ingredients against a brand name gentle detergent to ensure you are getting the best value .
#Text=Add laundry detergent .
#Text=Laundry softener is also recommended to keep your leggings soft and smelling fresh , but it is not required .
#Text=If you are unsure of how much detergent to put in , use the mantra ' less is more ' .
#Text=Remember that adding too much detergent will stain your leggings and leave undesired residue .
#Text=Wash your leggings .
#Text=Be sure to wash them in cold water on the gentle cycle .
#Text=Any other setting will likely be too harsh and may damage your leggings or ruin the coloring .
#Text=Put your leggings on clothes hangers or a drying rack to dry .
#Text=This will help them to last longer than putting them in the dryer .
#Text=If you choose to dry them outside , keep them inside out to keep from getting sun damage .
#Text=Cleaning Your Leggings in the Sink
#Text=Separate your leggings from the rest of your dirty clothing to prevent color damage .
#Text=If possible , put all your leggings into a different laundry basket to ensure that you do not accidentally wash them with all your other clothes .
#Text=Use a cold water laundry detergent .
#Text=Gentle detergent is a great choice , but it is also okay to use non-concentrated detergent .
#Text=If you do not have either of these detergents , it would be best to purchase one .
#Text=To determine which brand to buy , it may be helpful to look into a website like Consumer Reports or ask advice from someone you trust .
#Text=Prepare your sink for clothes washing .
#Text=Remove any items nearby that may catch on your leggings and make sure the sink is free of food stains , grease , and grime .
#Text=Clean your sink if necessary , fill at least halfway with water , then add 2 oz of laundry softener and 1/4 of a cup of laundry detergent .
#Text=Adding too much detergent will discolor your clothing by leaving light spots , so remember that when it comes to detergent , less is more .
#Text=Mix the water until both the laundry softener and the detergent completely dissolve .
#Text=Turn your leggings inside out and put them in the water .
#Text=Avoid putting more than 4 or 5 pairs of leggings in the water together at one time .
#Text=If you are not sure if your leggings will bleed color , wash each pair individually to save your clothing from discoloration .
#Text=Clean your leggings .
#Text=Remember to be gentle so the fabric is not strained .
#Text=Let them soak in the water for about 5 minutes .

#Text=Swish them around to shake off dust and dirt particles and gently scrub them with your hands to remove any stains , then let them soak for another 10 to 15 minutes to remove any additional dirt or grime .
#Text=Swish your leggings once more to ensure they are 100 % clean and fresh , then remove them one by one .
#Text=Drain all the water out of the sink .
#Text=Rinse it out so that no soapy residue remains , then fill the sink with water .
#Text=Rinse the leggings in the sink .
#Text=Gently swirl them in the water to remove all the soap .
#Text=Put your leggings on a drying rack or hang them on a clothes hanger to dry .
#Text=This will eliminate any damage that would occur from putting them in the dryer .
#Text=If you are drying your them outside , keep them inside out to prevent fading or other sun damage .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Add one cup of vinegar to one gallon of water and soak your clothes in this mixture for up to 30 minutes before washing them normally .
#Text=This will help to preserve their coloring .
#Text=Wear your leggings multiple times before washing to preserve their life and color .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do not put your leggings into the dryer .
#Text=This will cause unnecessary wear and tear .
